events.originalText: Canadian astronomer Robert Weryk discovered ʻOumuamua (depicted), the first known interstellar object detected passing through the Solar System.
events.subtitle: Robert Weryk
events.headline: Canadian astronomer Robert Weryk discovers ʻOumuamua, first interstellar object in Solar System

events.originalText: British YouTube collective the Sidemen were formed as a Rockstar Games Social Club group in  Grand Theft Auto Online.
events.subtitle: YouTube
events.headline: British YouTube collective Sidemen formed in Grand Theft Auto Online

events.originalText: Hurricane Wilma became the most intense Atlantic hurricane on record with a minimum atmospheric pressure of 882 mbar (26.05 inHg).
events.subtitle: Hurricane Wilma
events.headline: Hurricane Wilma sets record as most intense Atlantic hurricane

events.originalText: The British government restricted the broadcast of the voices of representatives from Sinn Féin and several Irish republican and loyalist paramilitary groups on television and radio.
events.subtitle: 1988–1994 British broadcasting voice restrictions
events.headline: British government restricts broadcast of Sinn Féin representatives

events.originalText: The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell by 22.6 percent on Black Monday, the largest one-day percentage decline in the stock market index's history.
events.subtitle: Dow Jones Industrial Average
events.headline: Dow Jones falls by 22.6% on Black Monday

events.originalText: Iran–Iraq War: U.S. Navy forces destroyed two Iranian oil platforms in the Persian Gulf in response to an Iranian missile attack on a Kuwaiti oil tanker three days earlier.
events.subtitle: Iran–Iraq War
events.headline: U.S. Navy destroys Iranian oil platforms in Persian Gulf

events.originalText: Vietnam War: The Siege of Plei Me began with the first major confrontation between soldiers of the North Vietnamese Army and the U.S. Army.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: Siege of Plei Me begins in Vietnam War

events.originalText: A group of ethnic Hutu military officers failed in their attempt to overthrow the Burundian government.
events.subtitle: Hutu
events.headline: Ethnic Hutu military officers fail in coup attempt in Burundi

events.originalText: At a meeting of its general assembly, the European Broadcasting Union approved the staging of the first Eurovision Song Contest.
events.subtitle: European Broadcasting Union
events.headline: European Broadcasting Union approves first Eurovision Song Contest

events.originalText: The Guatemalan Revolution began with a small group of army officers led by Francisco Javier Arana and Jacobo Árbenz launching a coup against dictator Jorge Ubico.
events.subtitle: Guatemalan Revolution
events.headline: Guatemalan Revolution starts with coup against dictator Ubico

events.originalText: World War II: Allied aircraft sank the German cargo ship Sinfra, killing mostly Italian POWs.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Allied aircraft sink German ship Sinfra in World War II

events.originalText: First World War: Allied forces began engaging German troops at the First Battle of Ypres.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Allied forces engage German troops at First Battle of Ypres in WWI

events.originalText: American Civil War: Despite incurring nearly twice as many casualties as the Confederates, the Union Army emerged victorious at the Battle of Cedar Creek.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Union Army victorious at Battle of Cedar Creek in American Civil War

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: British forces led by Lord Cornwallis officially surrendered to Franco-American forces under George Washington and the comte de Rochambeau, ending the Siege of Yorktown.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: British forces surrender at Siege of Yorktown in American Revolutionary War

events.originalText: The Pennsylvania Gazette published a statement by Benjamin Franklin describing a kite experiment (depicted) to determine the electrical nature of lightning.
events.subtitle: The Pennsylvania Gazette
events.headline: Benjamin Franklin conducts kite experiment to study lightning

events.originalText: The Spanish ship San Felipe was shipwrecked on the Japanese island of Shikoku, and its cargo confiscated by the local daimyō.
events.subtitle: San Felipe incident (1596)
events.headline: Spanish ship San Felipe shipwrecked on Japanese island of Shikoku

events.originalText: A ceremony was held in Edinburgh marking the coming of age of James VI of Scotland as an adult ruler.
events.subtitle: Entry of James VI into Edinburgh
events.headline: James VI of Scotland comes of age as adult ruler
